page.title: 12MEDIA:T.V. TRANSMITTER
page.content: The{Sandy Heath transmitter,}national grid reference{TL204 494,}first became operational in January 1971. Channel 4 was added in November 1982. It is one of the most powerful transmitters in the U.K. with a power of{1000 kw.}(The other ones are at{Crystal Palace}and {Sutton Coldfield).}The height of the transmitter is{290 feet.}There are five tiers of aeriels. Each side of the transmitter is made up of triangles with sides of{1.98 metres. The whole aerial is protected by glass fibre weather proofing. The Sandy Heath transmitter site is unusual in that it is a manned station with a {mobile maintenance}base which transmits to relay stations. About{two {million people}receive signals from the transmitter, the recepton in Bedford being excellent.
